Award.AwardTitle: 4th International Conference on Plant Synthetic Biology, Bioengineering, and Biotechnology

Division.LongName: Div Of Molecular and Cellular Bioscience

Award.AbstractNarration: Nontechnical Description<br/>Plant synthetic biology intersects many disciplines, including plant biology, synthetic biology, computational modeling and mathematical analysis, and engineering sciences to enable crop improvement and enhanced bio-production of high value chemicals. The award provides registration support to facilitate participation of US-based researchers, including graduate students, postdoctoral researchers, and early stage investigators, in the 4th International Conference on Plant Synthetic Biology, Bioengineering, and Biotechnology Conference held virtually October 30-November 1, 2020. The meeting brings together researchers from various academic, industrial, and government sectors in an interactive and engaging meeting and enables students and early career researchers to learn from an interdisciplinary community of leading scientists and engineers through organized talks and virtual discussions<br/><br/>Technical Description<br/>Presented by the Society of Biological Engineering (SBE), the conference includes scientists and engineers from universities, industry and government, and consists of multiple sessions in areas such as: Redesigning Photosynthesis, Genome Scale Engineering, Organelles and Synthetic Compartments, Engineering Bioproduction, Biotic Interactions and Synthetic Communities, Sustainability, and Engineering Form. Through the interactive online platform the conference will provide a venue for scientific presentations from a diverse group of often field-separated biologists and engineers as well as international researchers working in various areas pertinent to plant synthetic biology. The conference will encourage student and trainee engagement in the field, as well as participation of women and underrepresented scientists in the field of plant sciences, synthetic biology, and engineering.<br/><br/>This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Plant synthetic biology is an emerging field that utilizes concepts from synthetic biology in conjunction with core engineering principles to enable crop improvement, environmental remediation, and enhanced bio-production of high value compounds that are uniquely produced by plants. Plant synthetic biology is rapidly becoming a field of great economic importance in a broad variety of industries, including medicine, energy, and agriculture.

The 4th International Conference on Plant Synthetic Biology, Bioengineering, and Biotechnology was held on October 30-November 1, 2020 on a virtual platform and brought together scientists, engineers and other stakeholders to discuss and share ideas, innovations and achievements for developing novel engineering tools and discussing new research regarding fundamental science. Sessions integrated the recent achievements made by academia, government, industry and non-profit organizations to discuss all advancements in the field.

The conference featured six technical sessions: (1) Redesigning Photosynthesis, (2) Genome Scale Engineering, (3) Organelles and Synthetic Compartments, (4) Engineering Bioproduction, (5) Biotic Interactions and Synthetic Communities and (6) Sustainability, and (7) Engineering Form. Although the conference was hosted on a virtual platform, live Q&A panel discussions allowed attendees to interact with the speakers and the content being presented. The conference also featured many breaks for networking and exchanging ideas regarding the material presented.
